Package mireka.transmission.immediate

Provides a class which makes a one-time attempt to transmit a mail to a domain.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ImmediateSender
    ImmediateSender sends a mail to a domain, which may include attempting delivery to more than one MX hosts of the domain until a working one is found.
    ImmediateSenderFactory  
    MailToHostTransmitterFactory  
    OutgoingConnectionsRegistry
    OutgoingConnectionsRegistry can tell if too many connections are open to a specific host at the moment.
    RecipientRejection  
    RemoteMta
    Collects identification information about a remote MTA as they become available, these informations are eventually used in delivery status notifications
    ResponseParser  
    Rfc821Status
    This class represents an SMTP status which does not include enhanced status code.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    PostponeException
    Indicates that the specific host, must not be connected at this time, because there are too many open connections to it or it recently failed.
    RecipientsWereRejectedException
    it is thrown if some - maybe all - recipients were rejected
    RemoteMtaErrorResponseException  
    SendException
    Signals an error occurred while attempting to transmit a mail to a remote domain.

Package mireka.transmission.immediate Description

Provides a class which makes a one-time attempt to transmit a mail to a domain.
